columns.name: name
columns.description: The name of the access point. This is the value of the Name tag.

columns.name: access_point_id
columns.description: The ID of the access point, assigned by Amazon EFS.

columns.name: access_point_arn
columns.description: The unique Amazon Resource Name (ARN) associated with the access point.

columns.name: life_cycle_state
columns.description: Identifies the lifecycle phase of the access point.

columns.name: file_system_id
columns.description: The ID of the EFS file system that the access point applies to.

columns.name: client_token
columns.description: The opaque string specified in the request to ensure idempotent creation.

columns.name: owner_id
columns.description: Identified the AWS account that owns the access point resource.

columns.name: posix_user
columns.description: The full POSIX identity, including the user ID, group ID, and secondary group IDs on the access point that is used for all file operations by NFS clients using the access point.

columns.name: root_directory
columns.description: The directory on the Amazon EFS file system that the access point exposes as the root directory to NFS clients using the access point.

columns.name: tags_src
columns.description: The tags associated with the access point, presented as an array of Tag objects.
